intro: Leonohebe haastii var. humilis, commonly known as the low-growing leonohebe, is a perennial shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. It produces clusters of pale blue to violet flowers during the spring and early summer. This variety is well adapted to rocky and coastal environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
